sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A plain discovery how the enemy and popish faction in the north upholds their interest now under the power and authority of the Parliament and Army, set forth in a letter from a northren [sic] souldier. Published by Iohn Musgrave, an eminent sufferer under the Earl of Strafford, the Prelats, the common enemy, and the commissioners of array in Cumberland. T. G. Murgrave, John, fl. 1654.
8 p.
s.n.], [London : Printed in the year, 1649.
Signed at end: T. G. Place of publication from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "June 21". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Published by Iohn Musgrave, an eminent sufferer under the Earl of Strafford, the Prelats, the common enemy, and the commissioners of array in Cumberland. T. G. Murgrave, John, fl. 1654.

s.n.], [London : Printed in the year, 1649.
